title: 492 Dead In Israeli Strikes On Hezbollah Strongholds In Lebanon
content: Israeli air strikes on Lebanon killed at least 492 people on Monday, including 35 children, the health ministry said, marking the deadliest day of cross-border violence since the Gaza war began.
summary: Israeli air strikes on Lebanon killed at least 492 people on Monday, including 35 children, the health ministry said, marking the deadliest day of cross-border violence since the Gaza war began.

title: PM Modi Meets Ukraine President Zelensky In New York
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a bilateral meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in New York on Monday.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a bilateral meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in New York on Monday.

title: Hezbollah Says Commander Alive After Israel Strike On Lebanon
content: Lebanon's Hezbollah said commander Ali Karake, who a source reported had been the target of an Israeli strike Monday on Beirut, was alive and had moved to safety.
summary: Lebanon's Hezbollah said commander Ali Karake, who a source reported had been the target of an Israeli strike Monday on Beirut, was alive and had moved to safety.

title: "Global Action Must Match Global Ambition": PM Modi At UN Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking at the United Nations Summit of the Future on Monday, said alongside terrorism, new areas of conflict are emerging and it is high time that "global action must match global ambition".
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking at the United Nations Summit of the Future on Monday, said alongside terrorism, new areas of conflict are emerging and it is high time that "global action must match global ambition".

title: Amazon Forest Has Lost Area The Size Of Germany, France To Deforestation
content: The world's biggest rainforest, the Amazon, has lost an area about the size of Germany and France combined to deforestation in four decades, a study showed Monday.
summary: The world's biggest rainforest, the Amazon, has lost an area about the size of Germany and France combined to deforestation in four decades, a study showed Monday.

title: US Scientists Demonstrate Method To Deflect Asteroids Using Nuclear Blast
content: In New Mexico, scientists are exploring a futuristic solution to defend Earth against asteroid threats: harnessing X-ray blasts from nuclear explosions.
summary: In New Mexico, scientists are exploring a futuristic solution to defend Earth against asteroid threats: harnessing X-ray blasts from nuclear explosions.

title: Success Of Humanity Lies Not In Battlefield: PM Modi At UN
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today called for reforms in the top global bodies, saying, "The success of humanity lies in our collective strength, not in the battlefield".
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today called for reforms in the top global bodies, saying, "The success of humanity lies in our collective strength, not in the battlefield".

title: Highlights: PM Addresses 'Summit Of The Future' At UN, Present India's Priorities
content: Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi to addressed the Summit of the Future at the UN General Assembly today at their headquarters in New York.
summary: Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi to addressed the Summit of the Future at the UN General Assembly today at their headquarters in New York.

title: US Woman Tried To Hire Hitman To Kill Wife Of Man She Met Online, Jailed
content: According to court documents, Sasser met David Wallace on Match.com and became obsessed after he revealed his engagement.
summary: According to court documents, Sasser met David Wallace on Match.com and became obsessed after he revealed his engagement.

title: Sri Lanka's New President And What Is At Stake For India
content: Sri Lanka has made history by voting leftist Anura Kumara Dissanayake to power.
summary: Sri Lanka has made history by voting leftist Anura Kumara Dissanayake to power.

title: Google Will Fund Global AI Education At The Cost Of 120M Dollars: Sundar Pichai
content: Pichai announced "Global AI Opportunity Fund" at the event and said that the AI education will be done in local languages, in partnerships with nonprofits and NGOs.
summary: Pichai announced "Global AI Opportunity Fund" at the event and said that the AI education will be done in local languages, in partnerships with nonprofits and NGOs.

title: US Millionaire Boss Caught Filming Nude Videos Of Nanny On Hidden Camera
content: Her job abruptly ended when she found a hidden camera in a smoke detector in her bedroom.
summary: Her job abruptly ended when she found a hidden camera in a smoke detector in her bedroom.

title: Japan Protests Airspace "Violation" By Russian Patrol Plane
content: Japan lodged a "very serious protest" with Moscow after a Russian patrol plane entered its airspace three times, the defence minister said Monday, calling it the first confirmed incursion since 2019.
summary: Japan lodged a "very serious protest" with Moscow after a Russian patrol plane entered its airspace three times, the defence minister said Monday, calling it the first confirmed incursion since 2019.

title: Thailand Official Collects Salary And Bonuses For 10 Years Without Working
content: Despite his decade-long absence, the government official remarkably escaped termination or penalties, continuing to collect his salary and bonuses without interruption.
summary: Despite his decade-long absence, the government official remarkably escaped termination or penalties, continuing to collect his salary and bonuses without interruption.

title: 356 Killed In Israeli Strikes On Lebanon, Raid Siren Go Off In Israel's Haifa
content: Israeli air strikes killed 356 people, including 24 children, in Lebanon on Monday, the Lebanese health minister said, in the deadliest cross-border escalation since war erupted in Gaza on October 7.
summary: Israeli air strikes killed 356 people, including 24 children, in Lebanon on Monday, the Lebanese health minister said, in the deadliest cross-border escalation since war erupted in Gaza on October 7.

title: With AI, Dead Celebrities Are Working Again And Making Millions
content: The dead-celebrity industry has proved lucrative. Despite Michael Jackson being about $500 million in debt at the time of his death, his estate has amassed a fortune of $2 billion, according to People.
summary: The dead-celebrity industry has proved lucrative. Despite Michael Jackson being about $500 million in debt at the time of his death, his estate has amassed a fortune of $2 billion, according to People.

title: Couple's 1.5 Million Pounds Mansion Left In Ruins By Previous Owner In UK
content: A couple, who bought Bochym Manor in Cornwall, England, were devastated to find the former owner gutted the property before leaving.
summary: A couple, who bought Bochym Manor in Cornwall, England, were devastated to find the former owner gutted the property before leaving.

title: Opinion: Biggest Takeaway From Quad Summit Is That It's Here To Stay
content: With enduring wars in Europe and the Middle East, China's belligerent activities in the Indo-Pacific region and emerging non-traditional security challenges in the region, the Quad had its task cut out.
summary: With enduring wars in Europe and the Middle East, China's belligerent activities in the Indo-Pacific region and emerging non-traditional security challenges in the region, the Quad had its task cut out.

title: OceanGate's Focus Was "Making Money" Rather Than Security, Says Ex-Employee
content: Testimonies from the first week of a US Coast Guard hearing have cast a damning spotlight on OceanGate and its founder, Stockton Rush, who was also killed during the tragedy.
summary: Testimonies from the first week of a US Coast Guard hearing have cast a damning spotlight on OceanGate and its founder, Stockton Rush, who was also killed during the tragedy.

title: 'Stranded' Sunita Williams Now Commands International Space Station
content: Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams is now commander of the International Space Station. She was in space on an eight-day mission that had to be extended to over eight months because the spacecraft she travelled in faced glitches
summary: Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams is now commander of the International Space Station. She was in space on an eight-day mission that had to be extended to over eight months because the spacecraft she travelled in faced glitches
